title: Nissan's ex-head Carlos Ghosn accuses Japanese authorities of collusion
text:
Carlos Ghosn has accused Japanese prosecutors of a conspiracy to oust him from Nissan as he fights back against corruption charges.

In an extraordinary filing at Tokyo District Court, former Nissan chairman Mr Ghosn claims that a trumped-up case against him was hatched in collusion with employees of the car firm over fears he might merge it with Renault.

Mr Ghosn is awaiting trial on four charges of financial misconduct and is currently out on bail in Tokyo. He denies any wrongdoing and his latest claims mean previous accusations he has made about a conspiracy are now part of the court's records.
